org.elasticsearch.action.bulk

Class BulkRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.elasticsearch.common.ContextAndHeaderHolder
      • org.elasticsearch.transport.TransportMessage<TransportRequest>
        • org.elasticsearch.transport.TransportRequest
          • org.elasticsearch.action.ActionRequest<BulkRequest>
            • org.elasticsearch.action.bulk.BulkRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CompositeIndicesRequest, HasContext, HasContextAndHeaders, HasHeaders, Streamable

    public class BulkRequest
extends ActionRequest<BulkRequest>
implements CompositeIndicesRequest
    A bulk request holds an ordered IndexRequests, DeleteRequests and UpdateRequests and allows to executes it in a single batch. Note that we only support refresh on the bulk request not per item.
    See Also:
    Client.bulk(BulkRequest)

      BulkRequest(ActionRequest request)
      Creates a bulk request caused by some other request, which is provided as an argument so that its headers and context can be copied to the new request

      • payloads

        @Nullable
public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> payloads()
        The list of optional payloads associated with requests in the same order as the requests. Note, elements within it might be null if no payload has been provided.

        Note, if no payloads have been provided, this method will return null (as to conserve memory overhead).

      • refresh

        public BulkRequest refresh(boolean refresh)
        Should a refresh be executed post this bulk operation causing the operations to be searchable. Note, heavy indexing should not set this to true. Defaults to false.

      • refresh

        public boolean refresh()

        public final BulkRequest timeout(TimeValue timeout)
        A timeout to wait if the index operation can't be performed immediately. Defaults to 1m.
